newsitem.title: GREECE: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 14.75PCT.
newsitem.headline: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 14.75PCT.

text.p: Greece's Alpha Credit Bank said its prime rate for working capital and fixed asset loans will be unchanged at 14.75 percent.
Alpha Credit, which reviews its rates weekly, said the maximum add-on would remain unchanged at 3.5 percent.

Its adjustable-rate mortgages remains at 15 percent. The bank launched 15-year mortgages in October 1995 with rates set at 12.0 percent for the first five years. Rates on these loans have been reduced to 11.50 percent. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
